name: "Wounded Heart" Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did Tracy move after her parents divorced?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	After her parents divorced, Tracy moved with her mother to New York where both of them stayed. Tracy didn't return to Wounded Heart until she found out that she could possibly obtain the ranch and sell it.

questions.text: Tracy first met Sean at the ranch. What relationship did Tracy and Sean have?
questions.explanation:
Stepbrother and sister.

	When Tracy entered the ranch, she saw a picture of herself, her mother, and her father on the wall. Sean came up behind her and told her that Jake had a portrait made of him, his mother, and Jake made and hung it in the living room.

questions.text: What was the name of the older ranch hand that Tracy knew as a child?
questions.explanation:
Jedediah.

	Tracy was thrilled to see Jedediah when he and T-Bone picked her up from the small airport. Jedediah always called her by the nickname, "Little Miss".

questions.text: When a fire broke out in the barn at Wounded Heart, where was everyone?
questions.explanation:
At a barbecue.

	The annual barbecue was going on when a fire was set in the barn. Everyone rushed to the barn where Jedediah was severely burnt and Tracy was almost killed by a post that fell. Sean saved her life.

questions.text: What was Frannie's nickname for Sean?
questions.explanation:
Shakespeare.

	Frannie, played by Anita Barone, told Tracy that she calls Sean "Shakespeare" because she knows that he writes. Jake got Sean into writing by giving him books to read and telling him stories about the ranch. Sean started writing down the stories on Wounded Heart.

questions.text: How much did Tracy find out Wounded Heart was worth?
questions.explanation:
8 million.

	Tracy went to see Graham Harrington and requested half of the closing price on Wounded Heart after she realized that she would be sharing the ranch with Sean. After a fire nearly killed Jedediah, Tracy changed her mind and decided to fight for the ranch.

questions.text: On the day that Jake died, who showed up at the ranch?
questions.explanation:
Tracy's fiancé, Darren.

	After Jake died, Tracy ran away to the place that her father built for her so she could practice jumping. Tracy wanted to be the first Lance to win a gold medal in the Olympics. Later that evening when Sean returned to the ranch, Tracy introduced him to Darren. Sean welcomed him to Wounded Heart.

questions.text: After breaking up with Darren, Tracy saw him helping Graham take Wounded Heart away from her.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Tracy broke her engagement off with Darren after realizing that she was in love with Sean. When Tracy showed up in court the next day, she found out that Darren was helping Graham take the ranch. However, Wounded Heart had already been established a historical landmark and could not be touched.

questions.text: When Sean decided to retrieve Tracy from the airport, what was he doing?
options: Looking at her picture and drinking
questions.explanation:
Watching the horses and drinking.

	After taking care of Wounded Heart, Tracy decided to leave the ranch and go back home. After she left, Sean took a bottle of alcohol down to the corral to watch the horse that Tracy broke. While watching the horse run, Sean decided he wanted Tracy back, tossed the bottle away, jumped in his Jeep, and went to the airport.

questions.text: What counter offer did Sean make to Tracy so she would stay?
questions.correct: A husband, a state-of-the-art-office, one-hundred percent of everything
options: The horse she broke, three meals a day, and unconditional love
questions.explanation:
A husband, a state-of-the-art-office, one-hundred percent of everything.

	Sean chased the airplane down the runway, but it took off. When he looked in his rear view mirror, Tracy was behind him. He turned the Jeep around and pulled up beside her. Tracy asked for seventy-five percent of everything if she stayed, but Sean countered and offered to remodel the barn as an office for her, give her one-hundred percent of everything, and a husband.
